page.title: 13WINTERINGHAM PARISH CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Church stands at the west end of the village. The large, stone built church with a 20 metre high {tower }is surrounded by a burial ground. 900 years ago Domesday Book said "Winteringham has a Church and a priest". Parts of that Church are still standing. Some of the stones used in building the tower in 1450 were taken from the Roman settlement of Ad Abum. There are{ arches }and {aisles} on each side of the{nave.}The pointed arches to the north were built earlier than the rounded ones to the south. The long{chancel }was built in about 1200. The five{bells,}the oldest one dated 1705, now stand on the floor of the tower. The {burial ground }is still used and {headstones }date from 1720.
